byline.contributor: Rod Nordland and Jawad Sukhanyar reported from Kabul and Daku, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

abstract: Feud between two police families in northern Afghanistan continues to claim lives, even as Pres Ashraf Ghani has ordered investigation into matter; both officials and news media are reluctant to address feud directly, signal of how infighting in areas free of insurgency pose challenge for stabilization efforts in country.
lead_paragraph: Prominent northern families are contesting a new killing, fueling a type of infighting that threatens government stability and the fight against the Taliban.
snippet: Prominent northern families are contesting a new killing, fueling a type of infighting that threatens government stability and the fight against the Taliban....

headline.main: An Afghan Feud Reignites, Putting Police Families at Odds
headline.print_headline: Aligned Against Taliban, Two Afghan Families Carry On a Bloody Feud
